author: Lloyd Chitsulo
title: Synod rebukes pastors for attending APM prayer service
text:
Blantyre Synod of the Church of Central Africa Presbyterian (CCAP) has distanced itself from a prayer service by former president Peter Mutharika at his residence in Mangochi on Friday.
Synod moderator the Reverend Humphreys Zgambo and general secretary Anderson Juma in a statement yesterday chided pastors who attended the event, stating they did not represent the synod.
Mutharika poses for a photo with the pastors Reads the statement: ‚ÄúThe synod would like to publicly confirm it did not sanction, approve or endorse the visit. The ministers concerned did so in their individual capacity.‚Äù
Juma confirmed writing the statement.
Mutharika, who is seeking a comeback in the September 16 2025 General Elections, hosted some pastors from Blantyre Synod for a prayer session at his Page House.
Some notable pastors who attended the prayers include former general secretary the Reverend Alex Maulana, the Reverend Innocent Chikopa and the Reverend Chikondi Banda, who led a delegation of 71 pastors.
According to a statement published on Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) Facebook page, the pastors allegedly pledged their support to Mutharika ahead of the September polls.
However, the synod‚Äôs statement said the pastors‚Äô sentiments did not represent the synod‚Äôs position.
It said an incumbent general secretary speaks on its behalf in accordance with Article 4.5.2 of their constitution.
‚ÄúThe same article provides that in the absence of the general secretary, the deputy shall be the spokesperson,‚Äù reads the statement.
Nation on Sunday ‚Äôs efforts to engage Maulana and Chikopa yesterday proved futile as they both could not be reached on their mobile phones.
The synod further said it remains non-partisan, sticking to its mandate of proclaiming the gospel of Jesus Christ.
The statement further stated that Blantyre Synod will always remain a faithful servant to God, a partner of the Malawi Government, other development partners and that it shall jealously guard against external forces that aim to antagonise both its ministers and Christians, especially as the general elections fast-approach.

author: Zonebourse
title: Le milliardaire chinois de l'eau embouteill√©e s'en prend √† Pinduoduo et ByteDance - Zonebourse
text:
L'une des personnes les plus riches de Chine s'en est pris aux entreprises technologiques ByteDance et Pinduoduo, qui lui auraient port√© pr√©judice ainsi qu'√† des marques chinoises. Zhong Shanshan, 69 ans, et son entreprise d'eau en bouteille Nongfu Springs ont √©t√© soumis √† une forte pression en raison d'une guerre des prix et d'attaques personnelles en ligne de la part d'internautes nationalistes qui ont fait perdre des milliards de dollars √† la valeur marchande de l'entreprise.
Lors d'un discours public prononc√© au d√©but du mois, M. Zhong a critiqu√© Pinduoduo, un acteur du commerce √©lectronique ax√© sur les rabais et fond√© par son compatriote milliardaire Colin Huang, le qualifiant d'"√©norme pr√©judice pour les marques et les industries chinoises", selon des rapports de presse publi√©s cette semaine.
Pinduoduo appartient √† PDD Holdings, qui g√®re √©galement Temu. Par le pass√©, la soci√©t√© a d√ª faire face √† des protestations de la part des commer√ßants de Temu contre les frais qu'elle pr√©l√®ve.
Lors d'un autre √©v√©nement, il s'en est pris aux applications Toutiao et Douyin de ByteDance - la version locale de TikTok - pour ne pas avoir fait davantage pour emp√™cher la propagation en ligne de rumeurs malveillantes √† son sujet.
"J'esp√®re que M. Zhang Yiming, Douyin, Toutiao et tous les m√©dias qui m'ont personnellement bless√© avec des rumeurs s'excuseront", a-t-il d√©clar√©. "J'attends vos excuses sinc√®res ! J'attends."
Pinduoduo, ByteDance et Nongfu Spring n'ont pas imm√©diatement r√©pondu aux demandes de commentaires sur les remarques de Zhong, qui ont suscit√© de nombreuses discussions sur les m√©dias sociaux chinois.
Huang, de PDD Holdings, et Zhang Yiming, fondateur de ByteDance, figurent aussi r√©guli√®rement en t√™te des listes de riches chinois. Selon la Hurun China Rich List publi√©e fin octobre, Zhang est la personne la plus riche de Chine, avec une fortune personnelle de 49,3 milliards de dollars, tandis que Zhong arrive en deuxi√®me position avec 47,9 milliards de dollars.

author: En r√©ponse √†
title: √ânergies renouvelables : une gabegie programm√©e ? Ce que cache le projet de PPE3 selon une √©tude ind√©pendante - l'information nationaliste
text:
Alors que le gouvernement pr√©pare le d√©cret PPE3, une √©tude d‚Äôexperts d√©nonce les fausses v√©rit√©s qui sabotent un d√©bat rationnel sur l‚Äôavenir √©nerg√©tique de la France.
Le projet de troisi√®me Programmation Pluriannuelle de l‚Äô√ânergie (PPE3), cens√© dessiner le futur du mix √©nerg√©tique fran√ßais, repose-t-il sur des postulats erron√©s ? C‚Äôest ce qu‚Äôaffirme une √©tude percutante du Cercle d‚Äô√âtude R√©alit√©s √âcologiques et Mix √ânerg√©tique, qui d√©monte, point par point, plusieurs assertions r√©p√©t√©es √† l‚ÄôAssembl√©e nationale et dans le d√©bat public.
Au c≈ìur de la critique : le d√©veloppement massif des √©nergies renouvelables intermittentes (√©olien et solaire), pr√©sent√© comme une solution incontournable √† la transition √©nerg√©tique, mais qui, selon les auteurs, constitue au contraire une impasse technique, √©conomique, √©cologique‚Ä¶ et strat√©gique.
Nucl√©aire et √©nergies renouvelables intermittentes : faux alli√©s
L‚Äôid√©e selon laquelle le nucl√©aire et les EnR intermittentes seraient compl√©mentaires est, selon l‚Äô√©tude, un contresens majeur. Les r√©acteurs nucl√©aires, con√ßus pour fonctionner en continu, subissent des contraintes importantes lorsqu‚Äôils sont r√©guli√®rement arr√™t√©s pour laisser place √† une production √©olienne ou solaire prioritaire sur le r√©seau. R√©sultat : une d√©gradation de la rentabilit√© du parc nucl√©aire, qui continue de g√©n√©rer des co√ªts fixes‚Ä¶ m√™me √† l‚Äôarr√™t.
√Ä cela s‚Äôajoute une aberration √©conomique : d‚Äôun c√¥t√©, EDF est contraint de ralentir ses r√©acteurs, tout en continuant √† en supporter les charges. De l‚Äôautre, les producteurs d‚Äô√©nergies intermittentes b√©n√©ficient de prix garantis, m√™me lorsque le march√© est satur√© ‚Äì ce qui provoque une hausse des prix pour le consommateur final. Le paradoxe est total : on produit plus, on paie plus, sans gain pour la plan√®te.
Un risque de black-out masqu√©
Avec 80 GW d‚ÄôEnR intermittentes d√©j√† install√©es ou en cours de d√©ploiement, la France approche dangereusement du seuil critique. Le projet PPE3 pr√©voit 70 GW suppl√©mentaires, ce qui porterait la capacit√© intermittente √† 150 GW, soit deux fois et demie celle du parc nucl√©aire. Le risque ? Une instabilit√© croissante du r√©seau, une surproduction massive les jours de vent ou de soleil, et √† l‚Äôinverse, des tensions les jours de calme plat.
Loin de s√©curiser l‚Äôapprovisionnement, ce mod√®le expose la France √† des p√©nuries, √† moins de recourir de plus en plus aux importations ou √† des centrales fossiles pilotables.
Aucun b√©n√©fice climatique
Contrairement √† ce que pr√©tendent les d√©fenseurs de la PPE3, cette fuite en avant dans les EnR n‚Äôapporte aucun gain en mati√®re de r√©duction du CO‚ÇÇ. Pourquoi ? Parce que l‚Äô√©lectricit√© fran√ßaise est d√©j√† d√©carbon√©e √† plus de 90 %, gr√¢ce au nucl√©aire et √† l‚Äôhydro√©lectricit√©. Ajouter de l‚Äô√©olien ou du solaire revient donc √† substituer une √©nergie propre‚Ä¶ par une autre √©nergie propre, mais plus ch√®re et moins stable.
L‚Äô√©tude avance un chiffre alarmant : le surco√ªt du projet PPE3 atteindrait 300 milliards d‚Äôeuros d‚Äôici 2050. Des milliards qui seraient bien mieux investis dans la d√©carbonation des secteurs r√©ellement polluants : transport, industrie et logement, responsables de 70 % des √©missions de gaz √† effet de serre.
Les EnR : une illusion industrielle
Autre contre-v√©rit√© d√©mont√©e : l‚Äôid√©e selon laquelle la PPE3 permettrait de faire √©merger une fili√®re industrielle fran√ßaise de l‚Äô√©olien et du solaire. En r√©alit√©, selon le rapport, les composants essentiels (panneaux solaires, turbines) sont massivement import√©s. Les exp√©riences de relocalisation comme celle de Photowatt, rachet√©e par EDF, se sont sold√©es par des √©checs. Quant aux emplois cr√©√©s, ils sont pr√©caires, sous-trait√©s, et dispara√Ætront au moindre coup d‚Äôarr√™t politique aux subventions.
Les projets d‚Äô√©oliennes offshore, tr√®s gourmands en argent public, cumulent tous les d√©fauts : co√ªt faramineux par kWh, composants import√©s, impact paysager, incertitude sur la durabilit√©. L‚Äô√©tude estime que les Fran√ßais paient, via leurs factures et leurs imp√¥ts, pour soutenir une industrie sans avenir, guid√©e uniquement par les int√©r√™ts d‚Äôun lobby puissant.
√Ä rebours de cette strat√©gie, le rapport plaide pour une relance massive du nucl√©aire, seule √©nergie √† la fois pilotable, d√©carbon√©e, souveraine et productrice d‚Äôemplois qualifi√©s. Contrairement aux discours alarmistes, les nouveaux r√©acteurs EPR2, s‚Äôils sont soutenus politiquement et b√©n√©ficient d‚Äôune planification √† long terme, sont parfaitement r√©alisables √† co√ªts ma√Ætris√©s.
Mieux encore, ils constitueraient un atout strat√©gique pour r√©industrialiser la France et garantir son ind√©pendance √©nerg√©tique, tout en permettant de maintenir des prix stables pour les m√©nages et les entreprises.
Le rapport du Cercle d‚Äô√âtude R√©alit√©s √âcologiques et Mix √ânerg√©tique interpelle. Il rappelle que les choix en mati√®re d‚Äô√©nergie engagent la souverainet√©, la stabilit√© √©conomique, la s√©curit√© et l‚Äôenvironnement. Et que de fausses certitudes, r√©p√©t√©es √† l‚Äôenvi par des responsables politiques ou des groupes d‚Äôint√©r√™ts, risquent de conduire la France dans une impasse technologique et financi√®re.
Dans un contexte de pr√©carit√© √©nerg√©tique croissante, il est plus que jamais temps de regarder les faits en face. Et d‚Äôavoir le courage de remettre en cause les dogmes. Car dans ce domaine comme dans tant d‚Äôautres, c‚Äôest bien la v√©rit√© ‚Äì et non l‚Äôid√©ologie ‚Äì qui devrait guider l‚Äôaction publique.
Illustration : DR
[cc] Breizh-info.com, 2025, d√©p√™ches libres de copie et de diffusion sous r√©serve de mention et de lien vers la source d‚Äôorigine

author: Dr. Tim Sandle
title: AI study redefines right heart health assessment - Digital Journal
text:
AI performed well in conducting preliminary readings of heart ultrasounds - Copyright AFP Fabrice COFFRINI A new application of artificial intelligence in the medical field has led to the development of a novel predictive model to aid medical professionals in assessing patient risk. This is a departure from traditional methods presents a significant advance in evaluating heart health.
The AI application comes from the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai. Here medical scientists have harnessed AI to enhance the assessment of the heart‚Äôs right ventricle , which sends blood to the lungs.
Conducted by a team using AI-enabled electrocardiogram (AI-ECG) analysis, the research demonstrates that electrocardiograms can effectively predict right-side heart issues, offering a simpler alternative to complex imaging technologies and potentially enhancing patient outcomes.
The research found that a deep learning-based ECG analysis tool is able to identify patients at high risk for poor right ventricular function. Areas deemed important by the AI for prediction are highlighted in increasing shades of red.
According to lead researcher Son Q. Duong : ‚ÄúWe aimed to find a better way to assess the health of the heart‚Äôs right ventricle, focusing on its ability to pump blood and its size. Traditional methods fall short, which prompted us to explore AI-ECG analysis as a potential solution.‚Äù
The medic adds: ‚ÄúThis novel method could expedite the identification of heart problems, especially in the right ventricle, and potentially lead to earlier and more effective treatment. It holds particular importance for patients with congenital heart disease, who often face issues in the right ventricle.‚Äù
To achieve this breakthrough, the researchers trained a deep-learning ECG (DL-ECG) model using harmonized data from 12-lead ECGs and cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) measurements. It was conducted on a large sample from the UK Biobank and validated at multiple health centres across the Mount Sinai Health System, measuring its accuracy in predicting heart conditions and its impact on patient survival rates.
Despite the success, the researchers say that while the use of artificial intelligence allows for more precise heart information from commonly available tools, it is in an early stage and doesn‚Äôt replace advanced diagnostics. Further work is needed to ensure the tool‚Äôs safety and correct applicability. Furthermore, the study‚Äôs predictions may vary across populations, relying on existing ECG and MRI data with inherent limitations. Its application in everyday clinical practice requires further exploration, cautioned the researchers.
The research has been published in the Journal of the American Heart Association . The research paper is titled ‚ÄúQuantitative Prediction of Right Ventricular Size and Function From the ECG.‚Äù
The study was supported by the U.S. National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute, National Institutes of Health and National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences.

author: James Olley
title: Arsenal sure didn't look like Premier League title-winners in loss to West Ham
text: LONDON -- The debate over whether [Arsenal](/football/team?id=359) can handle a [Premier League](/football/league/_/name/ENG.1) title run-in just grew louder. After falling short last season despite holding an eight-point lead at the beginning of April, the principal challenge this time around for manager Mikel Arteta was evolving the Gunners into a more robust proposition to last the pace. There had been clear signs of progress in that regard this season, but the manner of [Thursday's 2-0 defeat](/football/match/_/gameId/671218) to [West Ham](/football/team/_/id/371/west-ham-united) will spark familiar questions about whether Arsenal can triumph in what is threatening to be a multiway fight to be champions. - Stream on ESPN+: [LaLiga, Bundesliga & more (U.S.)](/espnplus/schedule/_/type/upcoming/categoryId/119cfa41-71d4-39bf-a790-6273a52b0259/channel/ESPN_PLUS) - Read on ESPN+: [Ranking the faves in all of Europe's competitions](/football/insider/story/_/id/39145448/ranking-champions-league-europa-league-conference-league-favorites) A row will continue over the opening goal given the ball may have drifted out of play as [Jarrod Bowen](/soccer/player/_/id/201089/jarrod-bowen) pulled it back for [Tom√°s Soucek](/soccer/player/_/id/230666/tomas-soucek) to score after 13 minutes. VAR official Craig Pawson took a long look but no camera angle could conclusively overturn the on-field decision and a goal was awarded. Regardless, Arsenal lacked the composure associated with serial title-winners. Their defending -- which led to [Gabriel Magalhaes](/soccer/player/_/id/236322/gabriel) hitting the ball against [Oleksandr Zinchenko](/soccer/player/_/id/217482/oleksandr-zinchenko) to give Bowen a chance to pounce -- was calamitous on the first goal. Their response in possession was even more troubling. Wasting chances at one end and conceding another soft goal at the other was a recipe for disaster. The pre-match talk of a summer signing coming back to haunt his former club came to pass but not in the manner anyone expected. This ended up being a night to forget for [Declan Rice](/soccer/player/_/id/238262/declan-rice) as ex-Arsenal defender [Konstantinos Mavropanos](/soccer/player/_/id/242705/konstantinos-mavropanos) scored his first Premier League goal with an excellent 55th-minute header. After excelling for his new club time and again this season, Rice endured the taunts of West Ham fans for the final 20 minutes or so here as a result of his ¬£105 million summer move to Emirates Stadium. Rice's form has been a big factor in Arsenal's apparent evolution but, in a moment that perfectly encapsulated their regression here, he gave away a penalty in stoppage time, bringing arguably the biggest cheer of the night from the away end. Few seemed to care that [David Raya](/soccer/player/_/id/196176/david-raya) saved substitute [Sa√Ød Benrahma](/soccer/player/_/id/194543/said-benrahma)'s spot kick as the final whistle came seconds later. Arteta has rightly praised the home atmosphere in recent times, given the transformation from the toxic disconnect that provided the soundtrack to the end of Arsene Wenger's time in charge -- but there was a tension in the air against the Hammers that did not dissipate all evening. There wasn't the maturity in Arsenal's play that we have come to expect, perhaps most obviously evidenced by their play in the final third. [Gabriel Jesus](/soccer/player/_/id/217289/gabriel-jesus) headed the ball over on 66 minutes and Martin Odegaard forced [Alphonse Areola](/soccer/player/_/id/148987/alphonse-areola) into a fine save at the end, but there was little else of note despite registering 77 touches in West Ham's box -- the most on record since 2008-09 in a single Premier League match for a team who failed to score. [Bukayo Saka](/soccer/player/_/id/280555/bukayo-saka) (who hit the post in the first half), [Emile Smith Rowe](/soccer/player/_/id/266697/emile-smith-rowe) and [Eddie Nketiah](/soccer/player/_/id/259486/eddie-nketiah) all registered shots on target in the final 12 minutes but none of them required anything other than a simple stop by Areola. Arteta, however, believed they created enough to win the game. "When you look at how much we generated in the game, to see the result is very disappointing," Arteta said. "But they were better than us in both boxes. They had two shots, with the penalty three. We had 30, I don't know how many touches in the box, how many situations, how many opportunities to score and we haven't done it. In football you have to do that better if you want to win. "It's what it is. We have to try to generate. If we don't score with 30 shots, then we have to do 50 or 60 to try to score. That's the only thing. I can't imagine a game where we have more touches in the box, more dominance and less situations for the opponent against a really good West Ham side. Today though, it wasn't enough to win the game." Their failure in front of goal will also only strengthen the argument a new striker is needed in January. "All we have is the players we have, the players I love the most," said Arteta. "What we have to do is try to get better situations, more training, raise the confidence and that's it. They've done it [before]." West Ham and manager David Moyes continue to defy expectations. After winning last season's Europa Conference League and selling Rice for a club-record fee, they now find themselves in sixth place on 33 points, the highest figure they have ever collected at this stage of a Premier League season. No wonder Moyes suggested the club is "getting ready to talk" about a new contract with his existing deal expiring at the end of the season. Thursday was West Ham's first win in this fixture since 2015 and, more remarkably, Moyes' first league away win at Arsenal, [Chelsea](/football/team?id=363), [Liverpool](/football/team?id=364) or [Manchester United](/football/team?id=360) in 73 attempts. "Football is played in many ways and tonight we did the part that maybe isn't talked about as much," said Moyes. "Brilliant defending. We did a good job on Arsenal tonight. They had lots of the ball, too much for my liking, but we did a great job." Asked about his team's aspirations for 2024, Moyes added: "We are not one of the top teams. We are trying to get up and grow the team." Arsenal, meanwhile, are in a different place. They believe they can be the top team. But this defeat showed there is more work to do.

author: elcolombiano@pulzo-hermes.com
title: Rituales para iniciar a√±o nuevo: velas, carta liberadora y palo santo
text: Cuando era adolescente, cada 31 de diciembre, me miraba en el espejo para repasar en voz alta las cosas que quer√≠a cambiar en el pr√≥ximo a√±o. Me promet√≠a bajar de peso, ser m√°s organizada, m√°s responsable. Me miraba tambi√©n para analizar minuciosamente aquello que me hab√≠a prometido hac√≠a un a√±o y no hab√≠a cumplido. Cierta desaz√≥n aparec√≠a cada a√±o. Y es que el 31 de diciembre es la fecha en la que m√°s nos evaluamos. Pensamos en nuestros errores, en lo que vamos a mejorar y en despedirnos de aquello que nos duele. Ese d√≠a aparece una valent√≠a de cambio que llega ante la posibilidad de un nuevo comienzo. (Vea tambi√©n: [Yerbas, velas, ba√±os y rituales se venden como arroz en las plazas de mercado de Medell√≠n](https://www.elcolombiano.com/medellin/agueros-velas-plantas-rutiales-fin-de-ano-se-venden-como-arroz-en-plazas-de-mercado-medellin-ME23361490)) Un alcoh√≥lico puede pensar en dejar la bebida; un fumador, el cigarrillo; el que sufre por amor, prometerse por fin superarlo. Hay esperanza en dejar atr√°s lo que nos duele. Por ejemplo, hacer las paces con la muerte de un ser querido, uno de los duelos m√°s frecuentes y dolorosos que aparecen en √©poca de Navidad, seg√∫n afirma la psic√≥loga Laura Restrepo. Para la experta, estos pensamientos esperanzadores, que presagian un cambio, son v√°lidos y el 31 de diciembre puede ser un buen momento para iniciar estos prop√≥sitos. Sin embargo, advierte que a pesar de los rituales que se hagan este d√≠a, cerrar verdaderamente uno, o varios ciclos, solo es posible con un trabajo de introspecci√≥n constante, de aprendizaje y, ojal√°, acompa√±ado de un terapeuta. ‚ÄúParte de hacer un proceso de duelo al terminar el a√±o tiene que ver con dejar que las emociones fluyan en uno. Aceptar y profundizar en lo que est√°s sintiendo y cuando sea el momento de dejar ir esa situaci√≥n, soltarla. Hay una frase que me gusta mucho de Jack Kornfield que es sobre el perd√≥n. Perdonar es renunciar a la idea de que pudo haber existido un pasado mejor. En todos los procesos de cerrar un ciclo, una etapa de la vida, una relaci√≥n, un trabajo, tiene que haber una capacidad de comprender que eso fue lo que ocurri√≥ y esa es la historia que debo agradecer‚Äù, dice Restrepo. Cerrar un ciclo se trata de mirar de frente al dolor, asegura la psic√≥loga. Luego de entender lo que nos duele y por qu√©, seremos capaces de aprender a convivir con ello ‚Äîel dolor hace parte de nuestra vida‚Äî y cerrar etapas que hacen da√±o. Luego nos transformamos: ‚ÄúEs importante dejar ir una situaci√≥n o una persona que nos hace da√±o. Esto ir√° acerc√°ndonos m√°s a nosotros, qui√©n es uno y qu√© es lo que realmente queremos ser‚Äù. Rituales para fin de a√±o Para la psic√≥loga Restrepo un ritual infaltable para finalizar o comenzar un a√±o es ir a un r√≠o a observar la corriente y nadar un rato. Estos son tres rituales que puede hacer en la noche del 31 de diciembre para empezar un [a√±o nuevo](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/ano-nuevo). (Lea tambi√©n: [¬øQu√© hacer si est√° triste en diciembre?](https://www.elcolombiano.com/tendencias/que-hacer-si-esta-triste-en-diciembre-AH19699898)) - Ritual de limpieza para decir adi√≥s El palosanto es una especie de planta que se usa para alejar las energ√≠as negativas y atraer las positivas. Este 31 de diciembre puede limpiar su espacio (una habitaci√≥n, la sala de estar, el ba√±o) con palosanto, salvia blanca o un incienso de su elecci√≥n. Con este ritual, seg√∫n expertos, vas a poder liberarte y transformar aquello que duele. Luego de decir estas palabras, se debe soplar la vela tres veces, pasarla por la cabeza, manos y la parte delantera y trasera del cuerpo.
